key_points.text:
Positive Sentiment:
Chevron announced it has completed its $53 billion acquisition of Hess following a favorable ICC arbitration ruling, securing access to one of the decade’s biggest oil finds off Guyana.
Chevron Completes Acquisition of Hess Corporation
Positive Sentiment:

Chevron CEO says Hess deal ruling eases uncertainty for oil industry
Positive Sentiment:
The U.S. Federal Trade Commission reversed an order barring John Hess from Chevron’s board, removing a regulatory overhang on the Hess acquisition.
Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX) is reacting to a wave of legal victories, deal completions, and industry commentary around its $53 billion acquisition of Hess, alongside mixed market sentiment.

Chevron (NYSE:CVX) Shares Down 1.2% - Here's What Happened
Negative Sentiment:
Although Chevron won its arbitration with Exxon, the tie-up timeline was pushed back over a year, delaying Guyana production and costing billions in potential revenue.
MarketBeat’s July 18 screener named Chevron among five promising oil stocks to research, alongside Exxon Mobil and Schlumberger.
